reviews.text:
A very small and simple station with step free access and rather minimal facilities provided such as basic shelter and seating and only a pair of ticket machines on the London bound platform. 

The station is kept in good condition with nice flower beds and a lovely looking ticket office and waiting room. Trains run to and from Hampton Court every half an hour from here.
Nice guy running the cafe, train services are really infrequent though, better off at surbiton

reviews.author_name: London Flareon Tokyo Ebisu - Swanslade 恵比寿-スワンズレイド
reviews.text: Thames Ditton is located in the town with the same name it is served by Southwest Trains, located near a tennis court, this station is used for weekend escapes. The station is clean, maintained properly, and. There is lots of fresh air to breathe. This is also among one of my favourite stations.
Would reccommend - less parking than hampton court though so if you are driving, i would suggest driving 30 seconds down the road to that station - frequent service

A functionable little offshoot of the main lines into London. Dangerously close to Thames Ditton Lawn Tennis Club too. If you disembark the train at this station you could find yourself on the courts...you could be squaring up against me soooooo stay sharp.
